optimization.validation.enhanced_convergence_analyzer¶

Source: src\optimization\validation\enhanced_convergence_analyzer.py

Module Overview¶

Enhanced PSO Convergence Criteria and Validation Algorithms.

Advanced Mathematical Theory¶

Convergence Detection¶

Diversity metric:

\[D(\mathcal{P}) = \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^{N} \|\vec{x}_i - \bar{\vec{x}}\|\]

Convergence criterion:

\[D(\mathcal{P}^t) < \epsilon_d \quad \text{and} \quad |f^t_{best} - f^{t-w}_{best}| < \epsilon_f\]

Stagnation Detection¶

Improvement rate:

\[R_{imp}^t = \frac{f^{t-w}_{best} - f^t_{best}}{w}\]

Stagnation if \(R_{imp}^t < \epsilon_{stag}\) for \(T_{stag}\) iterations.

Statistical Convergence Tests¶

Welch’s t-test for mean comparison:

\[t = \frac{\bar{f}_A - \bar{f}_B}{\sqrt{\frac{s_A^2}{n_A} + \frac{s_B^2}{n_B}}}\]

Confidence interval for convergence value:

\[\text{CI}_{95\%} = f_{best} \pm 1.96 \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{M}}\]

Convergence Rate Analysis¶

Linear convergence:

\[\|\vec{x}^{t+1} - \vec{x}^*\| \leq c \|\vec{x}^t - \vec{x}^*\|, \quad c < 1\]

Superlinear convergence:

\[\lim_{t \to \infty} \frac{\|\vec{x}^{t+1} - \vec{x}^*\|}{\|\vec{x}^t - \vec{x}^*\|} = 0\]

Quadratic convergence:

\[\|\vec{x}^{t+1} - \vec{x}^*\| \leq c \|\vec{x}^t - \vec{x}^*\|^2\]

Plateau Detection¶

Plateau metric over window \(w\):

\[P^t = \max_{\tau=t-w}^{t} f^{\tau}_{best} - f^t_{best}\]

Plateau detected if \(P^t < \epsilon_p\) for \(T_p\) iterations.

Architecture Diagram¶

graph TD A[Optimization Results] --> B[Compute Diversity] B --> C[Compute Improvement Rate] C --> D[Statistical Tests] D --> E{Diversity Check} E -->|D < ε_d| F[Low Diversity] E -->|D ≥ ε_d| G[Good Diversity] F --> H[Stagnation Check] G --> H H --> I{R_imp < ε_stag?} I -->|Yes| J[Stagnation Detected] I -->|No| K[Still Improving] J --> L[Plateau Detection] K --> L L --> M{Plateau?} M -->|Yes| N[Convergence Confirmed] M -->|No| O[Continue Monitoring] N --> P[Convergence Report] O --> Q[Next Iteration] style E fill:#ff9 style I fill:#9cf style P fill:#9f9

Usage Examples¶

Example 1: Basic Initialization¶

from src.optimization.algorithms import *

# Initialize with configuration
config = {'parameter': 'value'}
instance = Component(config)

Example 2: Performance Tuning¶

# Adjust parameters for better performance
optimized_params = tune_parameters(instance, target_performance)

Example 3: Integration with Optimization¶

# Use in complete optimization loop
optimizer = create_optimizer(opt_type, config)
result = optimize(optimizer, problem, max_iter=100)

Example 4: Edge Case Handling¶

try:
    output = instance.compute(parameters)
except ValueError as e:
    handle_edge_case(e)

Example 5: Performance Analysis¶

# Analyze metrics
metrics = compute_metrics(result)
print(f"Best fitness: {metrics.best_fitness:.3f}")

This module provides advanced convergence analysis and validation algorithms for PSO optimization in the controller factory integration context. Features include multi-criteria convergence detection, statistical validation, and real-time convergence monitoring.

Key Features:

  • Multi-modal convergence detection

  • Statistical significance testing

  • Real-time convergence monitoring

  • Adaptive convergence criteria

  • Population diversity analysis

  • Performance prediction algorithms

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#============ src/optimization/validation/enhanced_convergence_analyzer.py ============\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Enhanced PSO Convergence Criteria and Validation Algorithms.
  7
  8This module provides advanced convergence analysis and validation algorithms
  9for PSO optimization in the controller factory integration context. Features
 10include multi-criteria convergence detection, statistical validation, and
 11real-time convergence monitoring.
 12
 13Key Features:
 14- Multi-modal convergence detection
 15- Statistical significance testing
 16- Real-time convergence monitoring
 17- Adaptive convergence criteria
 18- Population diversity analysis
 19- Performance prediction algorithms
 20"""
 21
 22import numpy as np
 23import logging
 24from typing import Dict, Tuple, Any, Optional
 25from dataclasses import dataclass
 26from enum import Enum
 27import time
 28from scipy import stats
 29from scipy.signal import savgol_filter
 30
 31from src.controllers.factory import SMCType
 32from src.optimization.algorithms.pso_optimizer import PSOTuner
 33from src.config import load_config
 34from src.utils.numerical_stability import EPSILON_DIV
 35
 36
 37class ConvergenceStatus(Enum):
 38    """Enhanced convergence status indicators."""
 39    NOT_STARTED = "not_started"
 40    INITIALIZING = "initializing"
 41    EXPLORING = "exploring"
 42    CONVERGING = "converging"
 43    CONVERGED = "converged"
 44    STAGNATED = "stagnated"
 45    OSCILLATING = "oscillating"
 46    DIVERGING = "diverging"
 47    PREMATURE_CONVERGENCE = "premature_convergence"
 48    FAILED = "failed"
 49
 50
 51class ConvergenceCriterion(Enum):
 52    """Types of convergence criteria."""
 53    FITNESS_TOLERANCE = "fitness_tolerance"
 54    RELATIVE_IMPROVEMENT = "relative_improvement"
 55    POPULATION_DIVERSITY = "population_diversity"
 56    GRADIENT_BASED = "gradient_based"
 57    STATISTICAL_SIGNIFICANCE = "statistical_significance"
 58    STAGNATION_DETECTION = "stagnation_detection"
 59    PERFORMANCE_PLATEAU = "performance_plateau"
 60
 61
 62@dataclass
 63class ConvergenceMetrics:
 64    """Comprehensive convergence metrics."""
 65    iteration: int
 66    best_fitness: float
 67    mean_fitness: float
 68    fitness_std: float
 69    population_diversity: float
 70    convergence_velocity: float
 71    improvement_rate: float
 72    stagnation_score: float
 73    diversity_loss_rate: float
 74    predicted_iterations_remaining: int
 75    confidence_level: float
 76    convergence_probability: float
 77
 78
 79@dataclass
 80class ConvergenceCriteria:
 81    """Adaptive convergence criteria configuration."""
 82    # Fitness-based criteria
 83    fitness_tolerance: float = 1e-6
 84    relative_improvement_threshold: float = 1e-4
 85
 86    # Diversity-based criteria
 87    min_diversity_threshold: float = 1e-3
 88    diversity_loss_rate_threshold: float = 0.95
 89
 90    # Stagnation detection
 91    stagnation_window: int = 10
 92    stagnation_threshold: float = 1e-5
 93
 94    # Statistical criteria
 95    statistical_confidence_level: float = 0.95
 96    min_sample_size: int = 20
 97
 98    # Adaptive parameters
 99    enable_adaptive_criteria: bool = True
100    controller_specific_adjustment: bool = True
101
102    # Performance prediction
103    enable_performance_prediction: bool = True
104    prediction_window: int = 15
105
106    # Early stopping
107    max_stagnation_iterations: int = 50
108    premature_convergence_detection: bool = True
109
110
111class EnhancedConvergenceAnalyzer:
112    """
113    Advanced PSO convergence analysis with multi-criteria validation.
114
115    Provides comprehensive convergence monitoring, statistical validation,
116    and performance prediction for PSO optimization in controller factory
117    integration scenarios.
118    """
119
120    def __init__(self,
121                 criteria: Optional[ConvergenceCriteria] = None,
122                 controller_type: Optional[SMCType] = None):
123        """Initialize enhanced convergence analyzer."""
124        self.criteria = criteria or ConvergenceCriteria()
125        self.controller_type = controller_type
126        self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
127
128        # Analysis state
129        self.iteration_history = []
130        self.fitness_history = []
131        self.diversity_history = []
132        self.convergence_metrics_history = []
133
134        # Convergence state tracking
135        self.current_status = ConvergenceStatus.NOT_STARTED
136        self.convergence_detected_iteration = None
137        self.stagnation_counter = 0
138        self.last_significant_improvement = 0
139
140        # Statistical analysis buffers
141        self.fitness_buffer = []
142        self.improvement_buffer = []
143        self.diversity_buffer = []
144
145        # Performance prediction
146        self.performance_model = None
147        self.prediction_accuracy_history = []
148
149        # Controller-specific tuning
150        if controller_type:
151            self._apply_controller_specific_tuning()
152
153    def _apply_controller_specific_tuning(self) -> None:
154        """Apply controller-specific convergence criteria tuning."""
155        if not self.criteria.controller_specific_adjustment:
156            return
157
158        # Controller-specific convergence behavior patterns
159        controller_adjustments = {
160            SMCType.CLASSICAL: {
161                'fitness_tolerance': 1e-5,
162                'stagnation_window': 12,
163                'min_diversity_threshold': 5e-4,
164                'max_stagnation_iterations': 40
165            },
166            SMCType.ADAPTIVE: {
167                'fitness_tolerance': 5e-6,
168                'stagnation_window': 15,
169                'min_diversity_threshold': 8e-4,
170                'max_stagnation_iterations': 60,
171                'relative_improvement_threshold': 5e-5
172            },
173            SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING: {
174                'fitness_tolerance': 2e-5,
175                'stagnation_window': 10,
176                'min_diversity_threshold': 1e-3,
177                'max_stagnation_iterations': 35,
178                'premature_convergence_detection': True
179            },
180            SMCType.HYBRID: {
181                'fitness_tolerance': 8e-6,
182                'stagnation_window': 18,
183                'min_diversity_threshold': 6e-4,
184                'max_stagnation_iterations': 55,
185                'enable_performance_prediction': True
186            }
187        }
188
189        adjustments = controller_adjustments.get(self.controller_type, {})
190        for param, value in adjustments.items():
191            if hasattr(self.criteria, param):
192                setattr(self.criteria, param, value)
193
194        self.logger.info(f"Applied {self.controller_type.value} specific convergence tuning")
195
196    def analyze_convergence(self,
197                          iteration: int,
198                          best_fitness: float,
199                          population_fitness: np.ndarray,
200                          population_positions: np.ndarray) -> ConvergenceMetrics:
201        """
202        Comprehensive convergence analysis for current PSO iteration.
203
204        Args:
205            iteration: Current iteration number
206            best_fitness: Best fitness value found so far
207            population_fitness: Fitness values for all particles
208            population_positions: Position vectors for all particles
209
210        Returns:
211            ConvergenceMetrics with detailed convergence analysis
212        """
213        # Update history
214        self.iteration_history.append(iteration)
215        self.fitness_history.append(best_fitness)
216
217        # Calculate population diversity
218        diversity = self._calculate_population_diversity(population_positions)
219        self.diversity_history.append(diversity)
220
221        # Calculate convergence velocity
222        convergence_velocity = self._calculate_convergence_velocity()
223
224        # Calculate improvement rate
225        improvement_rate = self._calculate_improvement_rate()
226
227        # Calculate stagnation score
228        stagnation_score = self._calculate_stagnation_score()
229
230        # Calculate diversity loss rate
231        diversity_loss_rate = self._calculate_diversity_loss_rate()
232
233        # Performance prediction
234        predicted_iterations = self._predict_remaining_iterations()
235
236        # Convergence probability estimation
237        convergence_probability = self._estimate_convergence_probability()
238
239        # Statistical confidence
240        confidence_level = self._calculate_statistical_confidence()
241
242        # Create comprehensive metrics
243        metrics = ConvergenceMetrics(
244            iteration=iteration,
245            best_fitness=best_fitness,
246            mean_fitness=float(np.mean(population_fitness)),
247            fitness_std=float(np.std(population_fitness)),
248            population_diversity=diversity,
249            convergence_velocity=convergence_velocity,
250            improvement_rate=improvement_rate,
251            stagnation_score=stagnation_score,
252            diversity_loss_rate=diversity_loss_rate,
253            predicted_iterations_remaining=predicted_iterations,
254            confidence_level=confidence_level,
255            convergence_probability=convergence_probability
256        )
257
258        self.convergence_metrics_history.append(metrics)
259
260        # Update convergence status
261        self._update_convergence_status(metrics)
262
263        return metrics
264
265    def check_convergence(self, metrics: ConvergenceMetrics) -> Tuple[bool, ConvergenceStatus, str]:
266        """
267        Multi-criteria convergence check with detailed analysis.
268
269        Args:
270            metrics: Current convergence metrics
271
272        Returns:
273            Tuple of (converged, status, explanation)
274        """
275        convergence_reasons = []
276
277        # Criterion 1: Fitness tolerance
278        if metrics.best_fitness <= self.criteria.fitness_tolerance:
279            convergence_reasons.append("fitness_tolerance_reached")
280
281        # Criterion 2: Relative improvement
282        if (metrics.improvement_rate <= self.criteria.relative_improvement_threshold and
283            len(self.fitness_history) > self.criteria.stagnation_window):
284            convergence_reasons.append("relative_improvement_minimal")
285
286        # Criterion 3: Population diversity
287        if (metrics.population_diversity <= self.criteria.min_diversity_threshold and
288            metrics.diversity_loss_rate >= self.criteria.diversity_loss_rate_threshold):
289            convergence_reasons.append("population_diversity_loss")
290
291        # Criterion 4: Stagnation detection
292        if metrics.stagnation_score >= self.criteria.stagnation_threshold:
293            self.stagnation_counter += 1
294            if self.stagnation_counter >= self.criteria.max_stagnation_iterations:
295                convergence_reasons.append("stagnation_detected")
296        else:
297            self.stagnation_counter = 0
298
299        # Criterion 5: Statistical significance
300        if self.criteria.enable_adaptive_criteria:
301            statistical_convergence = self._check_statistical_convergence()
302            if statistical_convergence:
303                convergence_reasons.append("statistical_significance")
304
305        # Criterion 6: Performance prediction convergence
306        if (self.criteria.enable_performance_prediction and
307            metrics.predicted_iterations_remaining <= 2):
308            convergence_reasons.append("performance_prediction")
309
310        # Determine overall convergence
311        if len(convergence_reasons) >= 2:  # Require multiple criteria
312            converged = True
313            status = ConvergenceStatus.CONVERGED
314            explanation = f"Convergence detected: {', '.join(convergence_reasons)}"
315        elif "stagnation_detected" in convergence_reasons:
316            converged = True
317            status = ConvergenceStatus.STAGNATED
318            explanation = "Optimization stagnated - no significant improvement"
319        elif self._detect_premature_convergence(metrics):
320            converged = False
321            status = ConvergenceStatus.PREMATURE_CONVERGENCE
322            explanation = "Premature convergence detected - consider parameter adjustment"
323        elif metrics.convergence_velocity < 0:  # Diverging
324            converged = False
325            status = ConvergenceStatus.DIVERGING
326            explanation = "Optimization appears to be diverging"
327        else:
328            converged = False
329            status = self.current_status
330            explanation = f"Optimization continuing - {status.value}"
331
332        return converged, status, explanation
333
334    def _calculate_population_diversity(self, positions: np.ndarray) -> float:
335        """Calculate population diversity using average pairwise distance."""
336        if len(positions) < 2:
337            return 0.0
338
339        # Calculate pairwise distances
340        distances = []
341        for i in range(len(positions)):
342            for j in range(i + 1, len(positions)):
343                dist = np.linalg.norm(positions[i] - positions[j])
344                distances.append(dist)
345
346        return float(np.mean(distances)) if distances else 0.0
347
348    def _calculate_convergence_velocity(self) -> float:
349        """Calculate convergence velocity using fitness improvement rate."""
350        if len(self.fitness_history) < 3:
351            return 0.0
352
353        # Use recent fitness values for velocity calculation
354        recent_fitness = self.fitness_history[-min(5, len(self.fitness_history)):]
355
356        # Calculate first and second derivatives
357        if len(recent_fitness) >= 3:
358            # Smooth the data to reduce noise
359            try:
360                smoothed = savgol_filter(recent_fitness,
361                                       min(len(recent_fitness), 3), 1)
362                velocity = float(smoothed[0] - smoothed[-1])  # Improvement over window
363            except (ValueError, np.linalg.LinAlgError) as e:  # P2: Savgol filter can fail with small windows
364                logging.getLogger(__name__).debug(f"Savgol filter failed: {e}. Using raw fitness difference.")
365                velocity = float(recent_fitness[0] - recent_fitness[-1])
366        else:
367            velocity = float(recent_fitness[0] - recent_fitness[-1])
368
369        return velocity
370
371    def _calculate_improvement_rate(self) -> float:
372        """Calculate relative improvement rate over recent iterations."""
373        if len(self.fitness_history) < 2:
374            return 0.0
375
376        window_size = min(self.criteria.stagnation_window, len(self.fitness_history))
377        recent_fitness = self.fitness_history[-window_size:]
378
379        if len(recent_fitness) < 2:
380            return 0.0
381
382        initial_fitness = recent_fitness[0]
383        final_fitness = recent_fitness[-1]
384
385        # Issue #13: Standardized division protection
386        if abs(initial_fitness) < EPSILON_DIV:
387            return 0.0
388
389        improvement_rate = (initial_fitness - final_fitness) / abs(initial_fitness)
390        return float(max(0.0, improvement_rate))
391
392    def _calculate_stagnation_score(self) -> float:
393        """Calculate stagnation score based on recent fitness variations."""
394        if len(self.fitness_history) < self.criteria.stagnation_window:
395            return 0.0
396
397        recent_fitness = self.fitness_history[-self.criteria.stagnation_window:]
398
399        # Calculate coefficient of variation
400        mean_fitness = np.mean(recent_fitness)
401        std_fitness = np.std(recent_fitness)
402
403        # Issue #13: Standardized division protection
404        if abs(mean_fitness) < EPSILON_DIV:
405            cv = 0.0
406        else:
407            cv = std_fitness / abs(mean_fitness)
408
409        # Stagnation score is inverse of coefficient of variation
410        stagnation_score = 1.0 / (1.0 + cv * 100)
411
412        return float(stagnation_score)
413
414    def _calculate_diversity_loss_rate(self) -> float:
415        """Calculate rate of population diversity loss."""
416        if len(self.diversity_history) < 3:
417            return 0.0
418
419        # Compare recent diversity to initial diversity
420        initial_diversity = np.mean(self.diversity_history[:3])
421        recent_diversity = np.mean(self.diversity_history[-3:])
422
423        # Issue #13: Standardized division protection
424        if initial_diversity < EPSILON_DIV:
425            return 0.0
426
427        diversity_retention = recent_diversity / initial_diversity
428        diversity_loss_rate = 1.0 - diversity_retention
429
430        return float(max(0.0, min(1.0, diversity_loss_rate)))
431
432    def _predict_remaining_iterations(self) -> int:
433        """Predict remaining iterations until convergence."""
434        if not self.criteria.enable_performance_prediction:
435            return -1
436
437        if len(self.fitness_history) < self.criteria.prediction_window:
438            return -1
439
440        # Use simple exponential decay model for prediction
441        recent_fitness = self.fitness_history[-self.criteria.prediction_window:]
442
443        try:
444            # Fit exponential decay: f(t) = a * exp(-b * t) + c
445            iterations = np.arange(len(recent_fitness))
446
447            # Linearize by taking log of (fitness - min_fitness + epsilon)
448            min_fitness = min(recent_fitness)
449            # Issue #13: Standardized division protection for log domain
450            log_fitness = np.log(np.array(recent_fitness) - min_fitness + EPSILON_DIV)
451
452            # Linear regression on log scale
453            coeffs = np.polyfit(iterations, log_fitness, 1)
454            decay_rate = -coeffs[0]
455
456            if decay_rate > 0:
457                # Predict iterations to reach fitness tolerance
458                current_fitness = recent_fitness[-1]
459                target_fitness = self.criteria.fitness_tolerance
460
461                if current_fitness > target_fitness:
462                    remaining_log_improvement = np.log(
463                        (current_fitness - target_fitness + EPSILON_DIV) /
464                        (current_fitness - min_fitness + EPSILON_DIV)
465                    )
466                    predicted_iterations = int(remaining_log_improvement / decay_rate)
467                    return max(0, min(predicted_iterations, 1000))  # Cap at 1000
468
469        except (ValueError, RuntimeError, FloatingPointError) as e:  # P2: Convergence prediction is optional
470            logging.getLogger(__name__).debug(f"Convergence prediction failed: {e}")
471
472        return -1  # Prediction failed
473
474    def _estimate_convergence_probability(self) -> float:
475        """Estimate probability of successful convergence."""
476        if len(self.fitness_history) < 5:
477            return 0.5  # Neutral probability initially
478
479        factors = []
480
481        # Factor 1: Improvement consistency
482        recent_improvements = []
483        for i in range(1, min(10, len(self.fitness_history))):
484            improvement = self.fitness_history[-i-1] - self.fitness_history[-i]
485            recent_improvements.append(improvement)
486
487        if recent_improvements:
488            positive_improvements = sum(1 for imp in recent_improvements if imp > 0)
489            improvement_consistency = positive_improvements / len(recent_improvements)
490            factors.append(improvement_consistency)
491
492        # Factor 2: Convergence velocity stability
493        if len(self.convergence_metrics_history) >= 3:
494            recent_velocities = [m.convergence_velocity for m in self.convergence_metrics_history[-3:]]
495            # Issue #13: Standardized division protection
496            velocity_stability = 1.0 - np.std(recent_velocities) / (np.mean(np.abs(recent_velocities)) + EPSILON_DIV)
497            factors.append(max(0.0, velocity_stability))
498
499        # Factor 3: Diversity maintenance
500        if len(self.diversity_history) >= 5:
501            diversity_trend = np.polyfit(range(len(self.diversity_history)), self.diversity_history, 1)[0]
502            diversity_factor = 1.0 / (1.0 + abs(diversity_trend) * 100)
503            factors.append(diversity_factor)
504
505        # Combine factors
506        if factors:
507            probability = np.mean(factors)
508        else:
509            probability = 0.5
510
511        return float(np.clip(probability, 0.0, 1.0))
512
513    def _calculate_statistical_confidence(self) -> float:
514        """Calculate statistical confidence in convergence assessment."""
515        if len(self.fitness_history) < self.criteria.min_sample_size:
516            return 0.0
517
518        # Use recent fitness values for statistical analysis
519        sample_size = min(self.criteria.min_sample_size, len(self.fitness_history))
520        recent_fitness = self.fitness_history[-sample_size:]
521
522        # Calculate confidence interval for mean fitness
523        try:
524            mean_fitness = np.mean(recent_fitness)
525            sem = stats.sem(recent_fitness)  # Standard error of mean
526
527            if sem > 0:
528                # Calculate confidence interval
529                confidence_interval = stats.t.interval(
530                    self.criteria.statistical_confidence_level,
531                    len(recent_fitness) - 1,
532                    loc=mean_fitness,
533                    scale=sem
534                )
535
536                # Confidence is higher when interval is narrower
537                interval_width = confidence_interval[1] - confidence_interval[0]
538                # Issue #13: Standardized division protection
539                normalized_width = interval_width / (abs(mean_fitness) + EPSILON_DIV)
540                confidence = 1.0 / (1.0 + normalized_width)
541            else:
542                confidence = 1.0  # Perfect consistency
543
544        except Exception:
545            confidence = 0.5  # Default moderate confidence
546
547        return float(np.clip(confidence, 0.0, 1.0))
548
549    def _check_statistical_convergence(self) -> bool:
550        """Check for statistical convergence using hypothesis testing."""
551        if len(self.fitness_history) < self.criteria.min_sample_size:
552            return False
553
554        # Compare recent performance to earlier performance
555        sample_size = min(self.criteria.min_sample_size // 2, len(self.fitness_history) // 2)
556
557        if sample_size < 5:
558            return False
559
560        early_sample = self.fitness_history[:sample_size]
561        recent_sample = self.fitness_history[-sample_size:]
562
563        # Perform Mann-Whitney U test (non-parametric)
564        try:
565            statistic, p_value = stats.mannwhitneyu(
566                early_sample, recent_sample, alternative='greater'
567            )
568
569            # Convergence if recent sample is significantly better
570            alpha = 1.0 - self.criteria.statistical_confidence_level
571            return p_value < alpha
572
573        except Exception:
574            return False
575
576    def _detect_premature_convergence(self, metrics: ConvergenceMetrics) -> bool:
577        """Detect premature convergence conditions."""
578        if not self.criteria.premature_convergence_detection:
579            return False
580
581        # Premature convergence indicators:
582        # 1. Very low diversity early in optimization
583        # 2. All particles very similar but fitness not optimal
584        # 3. Rapid diversity loss without corresponding fitness improvement
585
586        if len(self.iteration_history) < 10:  # Too early to detect
587            return False
588
589        # Check for rapid diversity collapse
590        if (metrics.population_diversity < self.criteria.min_diversity_threshold * 10 and
591            metrics.iteration < 20):
592            return True
593
594        # Check for fitness plateau with diversity loss
595        if (len(self.fitness_history) >= 10 and
596            metrics.diversity_loss_rate > 0.8 and
597            metrics.improvement_rate < 1e-4):
598            return True
599
600        return False
601
602    def _update_convergence_status(self, metrics: ConvergenceMetrics) -> None:
603        """Update internal convergence status based on metrics."""
604        if self.current_status == ConvergenceStatus.NOT_STARTED:
605            self.current_status = ConvergenceStatus.INITIALIZING
606
607        elif self.current_status == ConvergenceStatus.INITIALIZING and metrics.iteration > 5:
608            if metrics.convergence_velocity > 0:
609                self.current_status = ConvergenceStatus.EXPLORING
610            else:
611                self.current_status = ConvergenceStatus.DIVERGING
612
613        elif self.current_status == ConvergenceStatus.EXPLORING:
614            if metrics.improvement_rate < 0.01 and metrics.population_diversity < 0.1:
615                self.current_status = ConvergenceStatus.CONVERGING
616            elif metrics.convergence_velocity < 0:
617                self.current_status = ConvergenceStatus.OSCILLATING
618
619        elif self.current_status == ConvergenceStatus.CONVERGING:
620            if metrics.stagnation_score > 0.9:
621                self.current_status = ConvergenceStatus.CONVERGED
622
623    def get_convergence_diagnostics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
624        """Get comprehensive convergence diagnostics."""
625        if not self.convergence_metrics_history:
626            return {'status': 'no_data'}
627
628        latest_metrics = self.convergence_metrics_history[-1]
629
630        return {
631            'current_status': self.current_status.value,
632            'convergence_detected_iteration': self.convergence_detected_iteration,
633            'total_iterations': len(self.iteration_history),
634            'stagnation_counter': self.stagnation_counter,
635            'latest_metrics': {
636                'best_fitness': latest_metrics.best_fitness,
637                'population_diversity': latest_metrics.population_diversity,
638                'convergence_velocity': latest_metrics.convergence_velocity,
639                'improvement_rate': latest_metrics.improvement_rate,
640                'convergence_probability': latest_metrics.convergence_probability,
641                'confidence_level': latest_metrics.confidence_level
642            },
643            'convergence_criteria': {
644                'fitness_tolerance': self.criteria.fitness_tolerance,
645                'relative_improvement_threshold': self.criteria.relative_improvement_threshold,
646                'min_diversity_threshold': self.criteria.min_diversity_threshold,
647                'stagnation_window': self.criteria.stagnation_window
648            },
649            'controller_type': self.controller_type.value if self.controller_type else 'unknown',
650            'prediction_accuracy': np.mean(self.prediction_accuracy_history) if self.prediction_accuracy_history else 0.0
651        }
652
653    def export_convergence_analysis(self, output_path: str = "convergence_analysis.json") -> Dict[str, Any]:
654        """Export detailed convergence analysis."""
655        analysis_data = {
656            'metadata': {
657                'controller_type': self.controller_type.value if self.controller_type else 'unknown',
658                'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'),
659                'total_iterations': len(self.iteration_history),
660                'final_status': self.current_status.value
661            },
662            'convergence_history': {
663                'iterations': self.iteration_history,
664                'fitness_values': self.fitness_history,
665                'diversity_values': self.diversity_history,
666                'metrics': [
667                    {
668                        'iteration': m.iteration,
669                        'best_fitness': m.best_fitness,
670                        'population_diversity': m.population_diversity,
671                        'convergence_velocity': m.convergence_velocity,
672                        'improvement_rate': m.improvement_rate,
673                        'convergence_probability': m.convergence_probability
674                    }
675                    for m in self.convergence_metrics_history
676                ]
677            },
678            'convergence_criteria': {
679                'fitness_tolerance': self.criteria.fitness_tolerance,
680                'relative_improvement_threshold': self.criteria.relative_improvement_threshold,
681                'min_diversity_threshold': self.criteria.min_diversity_threshold,
682                'stagnation_window': self.criteria.stagnation_window,
683                'max_stagnation_iterations': self.criteria.max_stagnation_iterations
684            },
685            'final_diagnostics': self.get_convergence_diagnostics()
686        }
687
688        # Save to file
689        import json
690        with open(output_path, 'w') as f:
691            json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2)
692
693        self.logger.info(f"Convergence analysis exported to {output_path}")
694        return analysis_data
695
696
697class PSOConvergenceValidator:
698    """
699    Validation framework for PSO convergence algorithms.
700
701    Tests and validates convergence detection accuracy across different
702    optimization scenarios and controller types.
703    """
704
705    def __init__(self):
706        """Initialize PSO convergence validator."""
707        self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
708        self.validation_results = {}
709
710    def validate_convergence_detection(self,
711                                     controller_type: SMCType,
712                                     test_scenarios: int = 5) -> Dict[str, Any]:
713        """
714        Validate convergence detection accuracy for controller type.
715
716        Args:
717            controller_type: Controller type to test
718            test_scenarios: Number of test scenarios to run
719
720        Returns:
721            Validation results with accuracy metrics
722        """
723        self.logger.info(f"Validating convergence detection for {controller_type.value}")
724
725        validation_results = {
726            'controller_type': controller_type.value,
727            'test_scenarios': test_scenarios,
728            'scenario_results': [],
729            'accuracy_metrics': {},
730            'validation_successful': False
731        }
732
733        scenario_accuracies = []
734
735        for scenario in range(test_scenarios):
736            try:
737                scenario_result = self._run_convergence_test_scenario(
738                    controller_type, scenario
739                )
740                validation_results['scenario_results'].append(scenario_result)
741                scenario_accuracies.append(scenario_result['detection_accuracy'])
742
743            except Exception as e:
744                self.logger.warning(f"Scenario {scenario} failed: {e}")
745                validation_results['scenario_results'].append({
746                    'scenario': scenario,
747                    'error': str(e),
748                    'detection_accuracy': 0.0
749                })
750                scenario_accuracies.append(0.0)
751
752        # Calculate overall accuracy metrics
753        if scenario_accuracies:
754            validation_results['accuracy_metrics'] = {
755                'mean_accuracy': np.mean(scenario_accuracies),
756                'std_accuracy': np.std(scenario_accuracies),
757                'min_accuracy': np.min(scenario_accuracies),
758                'max_accuracy': np.max(scenario_accuracies),
759                'success_rate': sum(1 for acc in scenario_accuracies if acc > 0.7) / len(scenario_accuracies)
760            }
761
762            # Validation is successful if mean accuracy > 80%
763            validation_results['validation_successful'] = (
764                validation_results['accuracy_metrics']['mean_accuracy'] > 0.8
765            )
766
767        return validation_results
768
769    def _run_convergence_test_scenario(self,
770                                     controller_type: SMCType,
771                                     scenario: int) -> Dict[str, Any]:
772        """Run a single convergence detection test scenario."""
773        from src.controllers.factory import create_smc_for_pso
774
775        # Create test configuration
776        config = load_config("config.yaml")
777
778        # Create controller factory for this scenario
779        def test_factory(gains):
780            return create_smc_for_pso(
781                smc_type=controller_type,
782                gains=gains,
783                max_force=150.0
784            )
785
786        # Create convergence analyzer
787        analyzer = EnhancedConvergenceAnalyzer(
788            criteria=ConvergenceCriteria(),
789            controller_type=controller_type
790        )
791
792        # Run PSO with convergence monitoring
793        tuner = PSOTuner(
794            controller_factory=test_factory,
795            config=config,
796            seed=42 + scenario
797        )
798
799        # Mock PSO run for convergence testing
800        converged = False
801        convergence_iteration = None
802
803        try:
804            # Simulate PSO optimization with convergence tracking
805            result = tuner.optimise(
806                iters_override=25,
807                n_particles_override=12
808            )
809
810            # Extract convergence information
811            cost_history = result.get('history', {}).get('cost', [])
812
813            # Simulate convergence detection
814            for i, cost in enumerate(cost_history):
815                # Create dummy population for diversity calculation
816                dummy_population = np.random.random((12, len(result['best_pos'])))
817                dummy_fitness = np.random.random(12) * cost
818
819                metrics = analyzer.analyze_convergence(
820                    iteration=i,
821                    best_fitness=cost,
822                    population_fitness=dummy_fitness,
823                    population_positions=dummy_population
824                )
825
826                converged, status, explanation = analyzer.check_convergence(metrics)
827
828                if converged and convergence_iteration is None:
829                    convergence_iteration = i
830                    break
831
832            # Calculate detection accuracy
833            actual_convergence = len(cost_history) - 5  # Assume convergence 5 iterations before end
834            if convergence_iteration is not None:
835                detection_error = abs(convergence_iteration - actual_convergence)
836                detection_accuracy = max(0.0, 1.0 - detection_error / max(actual_convergence, 1))
837            else:
838                detection_accuracy = 0.0  # Failed to detect convergence
839
840            return {
841                'scenario': scenario,
842                'actual_convergence_iteration': actual_convergence,
843                'detected_convergence_iteration': convergence_iteration,
844                'detection_accuracy': detection_accuracy,
845                'final_cost': result['best_cost'],
846                'convergence_status': status.value if converged else 'not_converged',
847                'analysis_successful': True
848            }
849
850        except Exception as e:
851            return {
852                'scenario': scenario,
853                'error': str(e),
854                'detection_accuracy': 0.0,
855                'analysis_successful': False
856            }
857
858
859def run_enhanced_convergence_validation() -> Dict[str, Any]:
860    """Run comprehensive PSO convergence validation."""
861    print("=" * 80)
862    print("ENHANCED PSO CONVERGENCE VALIDATION - GitHub Issue #6")
863    print("Advanced Convergence Criteria and Validation Algorithms")
864    print("=" * 80)
865
866    validator = PSOConvergenceValidator()
867
868    validation_results = {
869        'validation_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'),
870        'controller_validations': {},
871        'overall_metrics': {}
872    }
873
874    # Test all controller types
875    controller_types = [SMCType.CLASSICAL, SMCType.ADAPTIVE, SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING, SMCType.HYBRID]
876
877    all_accuracies = []
878    successful_validations = 0
879
880    for controller_type in controller_types:
881        print(f"\n🔍 Validating convergence detection for {controller_type.value}...")
882
883        controller_result = validator.validate_convergence_detection(
884            controller_type, test_scenarios=3
885        )
886
887        validation_results['controller_validations'][controller_type.value] = controller_result
888
889        if controller_result['validation_successful']:
890            accuracy = controller_result['accuracy_metrics']['mean_accuracy']
891            print(f"✅ {controller_type.value}: Validation PASSED (Accuracy: {accuracy:.1%})")
892            all_accuracies.append(accuracy)
893            successful_validations += 1
894        else:
895            accuracy = controller_result['accuracy_metrics'].get('mean_accuracy', 0.0)
896            print(f"❌ {controller_type.value}: Validation FAILED (Accuracy: {accuracy:.1%})")
897            all_accuracies.append(accuracy)
898
899    # Calculate overall metrics
900    if all_accuracies:
901        validation_results['overall_metrics'] = {
902            'overall_accuracy': np.mean(all_accuracies),
903            'accuracy_std': np.std(all_accuracies),
904            'success_rate': successful_validations / len(controller_types),
905            'min_accuracy': np.min(all_accuracies),
906            'max_accuracy': np.max(all_accuracies)
907        }
908
909    # Print summary
910    print("\n" + "=" * 60)
911    print("CONVERGENCE VALIDATION SUMMARY")
912    print("=" * 60)
913
914    overall_metrics = validation_results['overall_metrics']
915    overall_accuracy = overall_metrics.get('overall_accuracy', 0.0)
916    success_rate = overall_metrics.get('success_rate', 0.0)
917
918    print(f"Overall Accuracy: {overall_accuracy:.1%}")
919    print(f"Success Rate: {success_rate:.1%}")
920    print(f"Successful Validations: {successful_validations}/{len(controller_types)}")
921
922    if success_rate >= 0.75:
923        print("\n🎉 ENHANCED CONVERGENCE VALIDATION: SUCCESSFUL")
924        print("✅ Advanced convergence criteria validated across controllers")
925        print("✅ Multi-criteria convergence detection working properly")
926        print("✅ Statistical validation algorithms operational")
927        print("✅ Performance prediction systems validated")
928    else:
929        print("\n⚠️  ENHANCED CONVERGENCE VALIDATION: PARTIAL SUCCESS")
930        print(f"✅ {successful_validations} controllers validated successfully")
931        print("⚠️  Some convergence algorithms may need refinement")
932
933    return validation_results
934
935
936if __name__ == "__main__":
937    results = run_enhanced_convergence_validation()

ConvergenceCriteria¶

Adaptive convergence criteria configuration.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class ConvergenceCriteria:
 3    """Adaptive convergence criteria configuration."""
 4    # Fitness-based criteria
 5    fitness_tolerance: float = 1e-6
 6    relative_improvement_threshold: float = 1e-4
 7
 8    # Diversity-based criteria
 9    min_diversity_threshold: float = 1e-3
10    diversity_loss_rate_threshold: float = 0.95
11
12    # Stagnation detection
13    stagnation_window: int = 10
14    stagnation_threshold: float = 1e-5
15
16    # Statistical criteria
17    statistical_confidence_level: float = 0.95
18    min_sample_size: int = 20
19
20    # Adaptive parameters
21    enable_adaptive_criteria: bool = True
22    controller_specific_adjustment: bool = True
23
24    # Performance prediction
25    enable_performance_prediction: bool = True
26    prediction_window: int = 15
27
28    # Early stopping
29    max_stagnation_iterations: int = 50
30    premature_convergence_detection: bool = True

EnhancedConvergenceAnalyzer¶

Advanced PSO convergence analysis with multi-criteria validation.

Provides comprehensive convergence monitoring, statistical validation, and performance prediction for PSO optimization in controller factory integration scenarios.

Source Code¶

  1class EnhancedConvergenceAnalyzer:
  2    """
  3    Advanced PSO convergence analysis with multi-criteria validation.
  4
  5    Provides comprehensive convergence monitoring, statistical validation,
  6    and performance prediction for PSO optimization in controller factory
  7    integration scenarios.
  8    """
  9
 10    def __init__(self,
 11                 criteria: Optional[ConvergenceCriteria] = None,
 12                 controller_type: Optional[SMCType] = None):
 13        """Initialize enhanced convergence analyzer."""
 14        self.criteria = criteria or ConvergenceCriteria()
 15        self.controller_type = controller_type
 16        self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
 17
 18        # Analysis state
 19        self.iteration_history = []
 20        self.fitness_history = []
 21        self.diversity_history = []
 22        self.convergence_metrics_history = []
 23
 24        # Convergence state tracking
 25        self.current_status = ConvergenceStatus.NOT_STARTED
 26        self.convergence_detected_iteration = None
 27        self.stagnation_counter = 0
 28        self.last_significant_improvement = 0
 29
 30        # Statistical analysis buffers
 31        self.fitness_buffer = []
 32        self.improvement_buffer = []
 33        self.diversity_buffer = []
 34
 35        # Performance prediction
 36        self.performance_model = None
 37        self.prediction_accuracy_history = []
 38
 39        # Controller-specific tuning
 40        if controller_type:
 41            self._apply_controller_specific_tuning()
 42
 43    def _apply_controller_specific_tuning(self) -> None:
 44        """Apply controller-specific convergence criteria tuning."""
 45        if not self.criteria.controller_specific_adjustment:
 46            return
 47
 48        # Controller-specific convergence behavior patterns
 49        controller_adjustments = {
 50            SMCType.CLASSICAL: {
 51                'fitness_tolerance': 1e-5,
 52                'stagnation_window': 12,
 53                'min_diversity_threshold': 5e-4,
 54                'max_stagnation_iterations': 40
 55            },
 56            SMCType.ADAPTIVE: {
 57                'fitness_tolerance': 5e-6,
 58                'stagnation_window': 15,
 59                'min_diversity_threshold': 8e-4,
 60                'max_stagnation_iterations': 60,
 61                'relative_improvement_threshold': 5e-5
 62            },
 63            SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING: {
 64                'fitness_tolerance': 2e-5,
 65                'stagnation_window': 10,
 66                'min_diversity_threshold': 1e-3,
 67                'max_stagnation_iterations': 35,
 68                'premature_convergence_detection': True
 69            },
 70            SMCType.HYBRID: {
 71                'fitness_tolerance': 8e-6,
 72                'stagnation_window': 18,
 73                'min_diversity_threshold': 6e-4,
 74                'max_stagnation_iterations': 55,
 75                'enable_performance_prediction': True
 76            }
 77        }
 78
 79        adjustments = controller_adjustments.get(self.controller_type, {})
 80        for param, value in adjustments.items():
 81            if hasattr(self.criteria, param):
 82                setattr(self.criteria, param, value)
 83
 84        self.logger.info(f"Applied {self.controller_type.value} specific convergence tuning")
 85
 86    def analyze_convergence(self,
 87                          iteration: int,
 88                          best_fitness: float,
 89                          population_fitness: np.ndarray,
 90                          population_positions: np.ndarray) -> ConvergenceMetrics:
 91        """
 92        Comprehensive convergence analysis for current PSO iteration.
 93
 94        Args:
 95            iteration: Current iteration number
 96            best_fitness: Best fitness value found so far
 97            population_fitness: Fitness values for all particles
 98            population_positions: Position vectors for all particles
 99
100        Returns:
101            ConvergenceMetrics with detailed convergence analysis
102        """
103        # Update history
104        self.iteration_history.append(iteration)
105        self.fitness_history.append(best_fitness)
106
107        # Calculate population diversity
108        diversity = self._calculate_population_diversity(population_positions)
109        self.diversity_history.append(diversity)
110
111        # Calculate convergence velocity
112        convergence_velocity = self._calculate_convergence_velocity()
113
114        # Calculate improvement rate
115        improvement_rate = self._calculate_improvement_rate()
116
117        # Calculate stagnation score
118        stagnation_score = self._calculate_stagnation_score()
119
120        # Calculate diversity loss rate
121        diversity_loss_rate = self._calculate_diversity_loss_rate()
122
123        # Performance prediction
124        predicted_iterations = self._predict_remaining_iterations()
125
126        # Convergence probability estimation
127        convergence_probability = self._estimate_convergence_probability()
128
129        # Statistical confidence
130        confidence_level = self._calculate_statistical_confidence()
131
132        # Create comprehensive metrics
133        metrics = ConvergenceMetrics(
134            iteration=iteration,
135            best_fitness=best_fitness,
136            mean_fitness=float(np.mean(population_fitness)),
137            fitness_std=float(np.std(population_fitness)),
138            population_diversity=diversity,
139            convergence_velocity=convergence_velocity,
140            improvement_rate=improvement_rate,
141            stagnation_score=stagnation_score,
142            diversity_loss_rate=diversity_loss_rate,
143            predicted_iterations_remaining=predicted_iterations,
144            confidence_level=confidence_level,
145            convergence_probability=convergence_probability
146        )
147
148        self.convergence_metrics_history.append(metrics)
149
150        # Update convergence status
151        self._update_convergence_status(metrics)
152
153        return metrics
154
155    def check_convergence(self, metrics: ConvergenceMetrics) -> Tuple[bool, ConvergenceStatus, str]:
156        """
157        Multi-criteria convergence check with detailed analysis.
158
159        Args:
160            metrics: Current convergence metrics
161
162        Returns:
163            Tuple of (converged, status, explanation)
164        """
165        convergence_reasons = []
166
167        # Criterion 1: Fitness tolerance
168        if metrics.best_fitness <= self.criteria.fitness_tolerance:
169            convergence_reasons.append("fitness_tolerance_reached")
170
171        # Criterion 2: Relative improvement
172        if (metrics.improvement_rate <= self.criteria.relative_improvement_threshold and
173            len(self.fitness_history) > self.criteria.stagnation_window):
174            convergence_reasons.append("relative_improvement_minimal")
175
176        # Criterion 3: Population diversity
177        if (metrics.population_diversity <= self.criteria.min_diversity_threshold and
178            metrics.diversity_loss_rate >= self.criteria.diversity_loss_rate_threshold):
179            convergence_reasons.append("population_diversity_loss")
180
181        # Criterion 4: Stagnation detection
182        if metrics.stagnation_score >= self.criteria.stagnation_threshold:
183            self.stagnation_counter += 1
184            if self.stagnation_counter >= self.criteria.max_stagnation_iterations:
185                convergence_reasons.append("stagnation_detected")
186        else:
187            self.stagnation_counter = 0
188
189        # Criterion 5: Statistical significance
190        if self.criteria.enable_adaptive_criteria:
191            statistical_convergence = self._check_statistical_convergence()
192            if statistical_convergence:
193                convergence_reasons.append("statistical_significance")
194
195        # Criterion 6: Performance prediction convergence
196        if (self.criteria.enable_performance_prediction and
197            metrics.predicted_iterations_remaining <= 2):
198            convergence_reasons.append("performance_prediction")
199
200        # Determine overall convergence
201        if len(convergence_reasons) >= 2:  # Require multiple criteria
202            converged = True
203            status = ConvergenceStatus.CONVERGED
204            explanation = f"Convergence detected: {', '.join(convergence_reasons)}"
205        elif "stagnation_detected" in convergence_reasons:
206            converged = True
207            status = ConvergenceStatus.STAGNATED
208            explanation = "Optimization stagnated - no significant improvement"
209        elif self._detect_premature_convergence(metrics):
210            converged = False
211            status = ConvergenceStatus.PREMATURE_CONVERGENCE
212            explanation = "Premature convergence detected - consider parameter adjustment"
213        elif metrics.convergence_velocity < 0:  # Diverging
214            converged = False
215            status = ConvergenceStatus.DIVERGING
216            explanation = "Optimization appears to be diverging"
217        else:
218            converged = False
219            status = self.current_status
220            explanation = f"Optimization continuing - {status.value}"
221
222        return converged, status, explanation
223
224    def _calculate_population_diversity(self, positions: np.ndarray) -> float:
225        """Calculate population diversity using average pairwise distance."""
226        if len(positions) < 2:
227            return 0.0
228
229        # Calculate pairwise distances
230        distances = []
231        for i in range(len(positions)):
232            for j in range(i + 1, len(positions)):
233                dist = np.linalg.norm(positions[i] - positions[j])
234                distances.append(dist)
235
236        return float(np.mean(distances)) if distances else 0.0
237
238    def _calculate_convergence_velocity(self) -> float:
239        """Calculate convergence velocity using fitness improvement rate."""
240        if len(self.fitness_history) < 3:
241            return 0.0
242
243        # Use recent fitness values for velocity calculation
244        recent_fitness = self.fitness_history[-min(5, len(self.fitness_history)):]
245
246        # Calculate first and second derivatives
247        if len(recent_fitness) >= 3:
248            # Smooth the data to reduce noise
249            try:
250                smoothed = savgol_filter(recent_fitness,
251                                       min(len(recent_fitness), 3), 1)
252                velocity = float(smoothed[0] - smoothed[-1])  # Improvement over window
253            except (ValueError, np.linalg.LinAlgError) as e:  # P2: Savgol filter can fail with small windows
254                logging.getLogger(__name__).debug(f"Savgol filter failed: {e}. Using raw fitness difference.")
255                velocity = float(recent_fitness[0] - recent_fitness[-1])
256        else:
257            velocity = float(recent_fitness[0] - recent_fitness[-1])
258
259        return velocity
260
261    def _calculate_improvement_rate(self) -> float:
262        """Calculate relative improvement rate over recent iterations."""
263        if len(self.fitness_history) < 2:
264            return 0.0
265
266        window_size = min(self.criteria.stagnation_window, len(self.fitness_history))
267        recent_fitness = self.fitness_history[-window_size:]
268
269        if len(recent_fitness) < 2:
270            return 0.0
271
272        initial_fitness = recent_fitness[0]
273        final_fitness = recent_fitness[-1]
274
275        # Issue #13: Standardized division protection
276        if abs(initial_fitness) < EPSILON_DIV:
277            return 0.0
278
279        improvement_rate = (initial_fitness - final_fitness) / abs(initial_fitness)
280        return float(max(0.0, improvement_rate))
281
282    def _calculate_stagnation_score(self) -> float:
283        """Calculate stagnation score based on recent fitness variations."""
284        if len(self.fitness_history) < self.criteria.stagnation_window:
285            return 0.0
286
287        recent_fitness = self.fitness_history[-self.criteria.stagnation_window:]
288
289        # Calculate coefficient of variation
290        mean_fitness = np.mean(recent_fitness)
291        std_fitness = np.std(recent_fitness)
292
293        # Issue #13: Standardized division protection
294        if abs(mean_fitness) < EPSILON_DIV:
295            cv = 0.0
296        else:
297            cv = std_fitness / abs(mean_fitness)
298
299        # Stagnation score is inverse of coefficient of variation
300        stagnation_score = 1.0 / (1.0 + cv * 100)
301
302        return float(stagnation_score)
303
304    def _calculate_diversity_loss_rate(self) -> float:
305        """Calculate rate of population diversity loss."""
306        if len(self.diversity_history) < 3:
307            return 0.0
308
309        # Compare recent diversity to initial diversity
310        initial_diversity = np.mean(self.diversity_history[:3])
311        recent_diversity = np.mean(self.diversity_history[-3:])
312
313        # Issue #13: Standardized division protection
314        if initial_diversity < EPSILON_DIV:
315            return 0.0
316
317        diversity_retention = recent_diversity / initial_diversity
318        diversity_loss_rate = 1.0 - diversity_retention
319
320        return float(max(0.0, min(1.0, diversity_loss_rate)))
321
322    def _predict_remaining_iterations(self) -> int:
323        """Predict remaining iterations until convergence."""
324        if not self.criteria.enable_performance_prediction:
325            return -1
326
327        if len(self.fitness_history) < self.criteria.prediction_window:
328            return -1
329
330        # Use simple exponential decay model for prediction
331        recent_fitness = self.fitness_history[-self.criteria.prediction_window:]
332
333        try:
334            # Fit exponential decay: f(t) = a * exp(-b * t) + c
335            iterations = np.arange(len(recent_fitness))
336
337            # Linearize by taking log of (fitness - min_fitness + epsilon)
338            min_fitness = min(recent_fitness)
339            # Issue #13: Standardized division protection for log domain
340            log_fitness = np.log(np.array(recent_fitness) - min_fitness + EPSILON_DIV)
341
342            # Linear regression on log scale
343            coeffs = np.polyfit(iterations, log_fitness, 1)
344            decay_rate = -coeffs[0]
345
346            if decay_rate > 0:
347                # Predict iterations to reach fitness tolerance
348                current_fitness = recent_fitness[-1]
349                target_fitness = self.criteria.fitness_tolerance
350
351                if current_fitness > target_fitness:
352                    remaining_log_improvement = np.log(
353                        (current_fitness - target_fitness + EPSILON_DIV) /
354                        (current_fitness - min_fitness + EPSILON_DIV)
355                    )
356                    predicted_iterations = int(remaining_log_improvement / decay_rate)
357                    return max(0, min(predicted_iterations, 1000))  # Cap at 1000
358
359        except (ValueError, RuntimeError, FloatingPointError) as e:  # P2: Convergence prediction is optional
360            logging.getLogger(__name__).debug(f"Convergence prediction failed: {e}")
361
362        return -1  # Prediction failed
363
364    def _estimate_convergence_probability(self) -> float:
365        """Estimate probability of successful convergence."""
366        if len(self.fitness_history) < 5:
367            return 0.5  # Neutral probability initially
368
369        factors = []
370
371        # Factor 1: Improvement consistency
372        recent_improvements = []
373        for i in range(1, min(10, len(self.fitness_history))):
374            improvement = self.fitness_history[-i-1] - self.fitness_history[-i]
375            recent_improvements.append(improvement)
376
377        if recent_improvements:
378            positive_improvements = sum(1 for imp in recent_improvements if imp > 0)
379            improvement_consistency = positive_improvements / len(recent_improvements)
380            factors.append(improvement_consistency)
381
382        # Factor 2: Convergence velocity stability
383        if len(self.convergence_metrics_history) >= 3:
384            recent_velocities = [m.convergence_velocity for m in self.convergence_metrics_history[-3:]]
385            # Issue #13: Standardized division protection
386            velocity_stability = 1.0 - np.std(recent_velocities) / (np.mean(np.abs(recent_velocities)) + EPSILON_DIV)
387            factors.append(max(0.0, velocity_stability))
388
389        # Factor 3: Diversity maintenance
390        if len(self.diversity_history) >= 5:
391            diversity_trend = np.polyfit(range(len(self.diversity_history)), self.diversity_history, 1)[0]
392            diversity_factor = 1.0 / (1.0 + abs(diversity_trend) * 100)
393            factors.append(diversity_factor)
394
395        # Combine factors
396        if factors:
397            probability = np.mean(factors)
398        else:
399            probability = 0.5
400
401        return float(np.clip(probability, 0.0, 1.0))
402
403    def _calculate_statistical_confidence(self) -> float:
404        """Calculate statistical confidence in convergence assessment."""
405        if len(self.fitness_history) < self.criteria.min_sample_size:
406            return 0.0
407
408        # Use recent fitness values for statistical analysis
409        sample_size = min(self.criteria.min_sample_size, len(self.fitness_history))
410        recent_fitness = self.fitness_history[-sample_size:]
411
412        # Calculate confidence interval for mean fitness
413        try:
414            mean_fitness = np.mean(recent_fitness)
415            sem = stats.sem(recent_fitness)  # Standard error of mean
416
417            if sem > 0:
418                # Calculate confidence interval
419                confidence_interval = stats.t.interval(
420                    self.criteria.statistical_confidence_level,
421                    len(recent_fitness) - 1,
422                    loc=mean_fitness,
423                    scale=sem
424                )
425
426                # Confidence is higher when interval is narrower
427                interval_width = confidence_interval[1] - confidence_interval[0]
428                # Issue #13: Standardized division protection
429                normalized_width = interval_width / (abs(mean_fitness) + EPSILON_DIV)
430                confidence = 1.0 / (1.0 + normalized_width)
431            else:
432                confidence = 1.0  # Perfect consistency
433
434        except Exception:
435            confidence = 0.5  # Default moderate confidence
436
437        return float(np.clip(confidence, 0.0, 1.0))
438
439    def _check_statistical_convergence(self) -> bool:
440        """Check for statistical convergence using hypothesis testing."""
441        if len(self.fitness_history) < self.criteria.min_sample_size:
442            return False
443
444        # Compare recent performance to earlier performance
445        sample_size = min(self.criteria.min_sample_size // 2, len(self.fitness_history) // 2)
446
447        if sample_size < 5:
448            return False
449
450        early_sample = self.fitness_history[:sample_size]
451        recent_sample = self.fitness_history[-sample_size:]
452
453        # Perform Mann-Whitney U test (non-parametric)
454        try:
455            statistic, p_value = stats.mannwhitneyu(
456                early_sample, recent_sample, alternative='greater'
457            )
458
459            # Convergence if recent sample is significantly better
460            alpha = 1.0 - self.criteria.statistical_confidence_level
461            return p_value < alpha
462
463        except Exception:
464            return False
465
466    def _detect_premature_convergence(self, metrics: ConvergenceMetrics) -> bool:
467        """Detect premature convergence conditions."""
468        if not self.criteria.premature_convergence_detection:
469            return False
470
471        # Premature convergence indicators:
472        # 1. Very low diversity early in optimization
473        # 2. All particles very similar but fitness not optimal
474        # 3. Rapid diversity loss without corresponding fitness improvement
475
476        if len(self.iteration_history) < 10:  # Too early to detect
477            return False
478
479        # Check for rapid diversity collapse
480        if (metrics.population_diversity < self.criteria.min_diversity_threshold * 10 and
481            metrics.iteration < 20):
482            return True
483
484        # Check for fitness plateau with diversity loss
485        if (len(self.fitness_history) >= 10 and
486            metrics.diversity_loss_rate > 0.8 and
487            metrics.improvement_rate < 1e-4):
488            return True
489
490        return False
491
492    def _update_convergence_status(self, metrics: ConvergenceMetrics) -> None:
493        """Update internal convergence status based on metrics."""
494        if self.current_status == ConvergenceStatus.NOT_STARTED:
495            self.current_status = ConvergenceStatus.INITIALIZING
496
497        elif self.current_status == ConvergenceStatus.INITIALIZING and metrics.iteration > 5:
498            if metrics.convergence_velocity > 0:
499                self.current_status = ConvergenceStatus.EXPLORING
500            else:
501                self.current_status = ConvergenceStatus.DIVERGING
502
503        elif self.current_status == ConvergenceStatus.EXPLORING:
504            if metrics.improvement_rate < 0.01 and metrics.population_diversity < 0.1:
505                self.current_status = ConvergenceStatus.CONVERGING
506            elif metrics.convergence_velocity < 0:
507                self.current_status = ConvergenceStatus.OSCILLATING
508
509        elif self.current_status == ConvergenceStatus.CONVERGING:
510            if metrics.stagnation_score > 0.9:
511                self.current_status = ConvergenceStatus.CONVERGED
512
513    def get_convergence_diagnostics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
514        """Get comprehensive convergence diagnostics."""
515        if not self.convergence_metrics_history:
516            return {'status': 'no_data'}
517
518        latest_metrics = self.convergence_metrics_history[-1]
519
520        return {
521            'current_status': self.current_status.value,
522            'convergence_detected_iteration': self.convergence_detected_iteration,
523            'total_iterations': len(self.iteration_history),
524            'stagnation_counter': self.stagnation_counter,
525            'latest_metrics': {
526                'best_fitness': latest_metrics.best_fitness,
527                'population_diversity': latest_metrics.population_diversity,
528                'convergence_velocity': latest_metrics.convergence_velocity,
529                'improvement_rate': latest_metrics.improvement_rate,
530                'convergence_probability': latest_metrics.convergence_probability,
531                'confidence_level': latest_metrics.confidence_level
532            },
533            'convergence_criteria': {
534                'fitness_tolerance': self.criteria.fitness_tolerance,
535                'relative_improvement_threshold': self.criteria.relative_improvement_threshold,
536                'min_diversity_threshold': self.criteria.min_diversity_threshold,
537                'stagnation_window': self.criteria.stagnation_window
538            },
539            'controller_type': self.controller_type.value if self.controller_type else 'unknown',
540            'prediction_accuracy': np.mean(self.prediction_accuracy_history) if self.prediction_accuracy_history else 0.0
541        }
542
543    def export_convergence_analysis(self, output_path: str = "convergence_analysis.json") -> Dict[str, Any]:
544        """Export detailed convergence analysis."""
545        analysis_data = {
546            'metadata': {
547                'controller_type': self.controller_type.value if self.controller_type else 'unknown',
548                'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'),
549                'total_iterations': len(self.iteration_history),
550                'final_status': self.current_status.value
551            },
552            'convergence_history': {
553                'iterations': self.iteration_history,
554                'fitness_values': self.fitness_history,
555                'diversity_values': self.diversity_history,
556                'metrics': [
557                    {
558                        'iteration': m.iteration,
559                        'best_fitness': m.best_fitness,
560                        'population_diversity': m.population_diversity,
561                        'convergence_velocity': m.convergence_velocity,
562                        'improvement_rate': m.improvement_rate,
563                        'convergence_probability': m.convergence_probability
564                    }
565                    for m in self.convergence_metrics_history
566                ]
567            },
568            'convergence_criteria': {
569                'fitness_tolerance': self.criteria.fitness_tolerance,
570                'relative_improvement_threshold': self.criteria.relative_improvement_threshold,
571                'min_diversity_threshold': self.criteria.min_diversity_threshold,
572                'stagnation_window': self.criteria.stagnation_window,
573                'max_stagnation_iterations': self.criteria.max_stagnation_iterations
574            },
575            'final_diagnostics': self.get_convergence_diagnostics()
576        }
577
578        # Save to file
579        import json
580        with open(output_path, 'w') as f:
581            json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2)
582
583        self.logger.info(f"Convergence analysis exported to {output_path}")
584        return analysis_data

PSOConvergenceValidator¶

Validation framework for PSO convergence algorithms.

Tests and validates convergence detection accuracy across different optimization scenarios and controller types.

Source Code¶

  1class PSOConvergenceValidator:
  2    """
  3    Validation framework for PSO convergence algorithms.
  4
  5    Tests and validates convergence detection accuracy across different
  6    optimization scenarios and controller types.
  7    """
  8
  9    def __init__(self):
 10        """Initialize PSO convergence validator."""
 11        self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
 12        self.validation_results = {}
 13
 14    def validate_convergence_detection(self,
 15                                     controller_type: SMCType,
 16                                     test_scenarios: int = 5) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 17        """
 18        Validate convergence detection accuracy for controller type.
 19
 20        Args:
 21            controller_type: Controller type to test
 22            test_scenarios: Number of test scenarios to run
 23
 24        Returns:
 25            Validation results with accuracy metrics
 26        """
 27        self.logger.info(f"Validating convergence detection for {controller_type.value}")
 28
 29        validation_results = {
 30            'controller_type': controller_type.value,
 31            'test_scenarios': test_scenarios,
 32            'scenario_results': [],
 33            'accuracy_metrics': {},
 34            'validation_successful': False
 35        }
 36
 37        scenario_accuracies = []
 38
 39        for scenario in range(test_scenarios):
 40            try:
 41                scenario_result = self._run_convergence_test_scenario(
 42                    controller_type, scenario
 43                )
 44                validation_results['scenario_results'].append(scenario_result)
 45                scenario_accuracies.append(scenario_result['detection_accuracy'])
 46
 47            except Exception as e:
 48                self.logger.warning(f"Scenario {scenario} failed: {e}")
 49                validation_results['scenario_results'].append({
 50                    'scenario': scenario,
 51                    'error': str(e),
 52                    'detection_accuracy': 0.0
 53                })
 54                scenario_accuracies.append(0.0)
 55
 56        # Calculate overall accuracy metrics
 57        if scenario_accuracies:
 58            validation_results['accuracy_metrics'] = {
 59                'mean_accuracy': np.mean(scenario_accuracies),
 60                'std_accuracy': np.std(scenario_accuracies),
 61                'min_accuracy': np.min(scenario_accuracies),
 62                'max_accuracy': np.max(scenario_accuracies),
 63                'success_rate': sum(1 for acc in scenario_accuracies if acc > 0.7) / len(scenario_accuracies)
 64            }
 65
 66            # Validation is successful if mean accuracy > 80%
 67            validation_results['validation_successful'] = (
 68                validation_results['accuracy_metrics']['mean_accuracy'] > 0.8
 69            )
 70
 71        return validation_results
 72
 73    def _run_convergence_test_scenario(self,
 74                                     controller_type: SMCType,
 75                                     scenario: int) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 76        """Run a single convergence detection test scenario."""
 77        from src.controllers.factory import create_smc_for_pso
 78
 79        # Create test configuration
 80        config = load_config("config.yaml")
 81
 82        # Create controller factory for this scenario
 83        def test_factory(gains):
 84            return create_smc_for_pso(
 85                smc_type=controller_type,
 86                gains=gains,
 87                max_force=150.0
 88            )
 89
 90        # Create convergence analyzer
 91        analyzer = EnhancedConvergenceAnalyzer(
 92            criteria=ConvergenceCriteria(),
 93            controller_type=controller_type
 94        )
 95
 96        # Run PSO with convergence monitoring
 97        tuner = PSOTuner(
 98            controller_factory=test_factory,
 99            config=config,
100            seed=42 + scenario
101        )
102
103        # Mock PSO run for convergence testing
104        converged = False
105        convergence_iteration = None
106
107        try:
108            # Simulate PSO optimization with convergence tracking
109            result = tuner.optimise(
110                iters_override=25,
111                n_particles_override=12
112            )
113
114            # Extract convergence information
115            cost_history = result.get('history', {}).get('cost', [])
116
117            # Simulate convergence detection
118            for i, cost in enumerate(cost_history):
119                # Create dummy population for diversity calculation
120                dummy_population = np.random.random((12, len(result['best_pos'])))
121                dummy_fitness = np.random.random(12) * cost
122
123                metrics = analyzer.analyze_convergence(
124                    iteration=i,
125                    best_fitness=cost,
126                    population_fitness=dummy_fitness,
127                    population_positions=dummy_population
128                )
129
130                converged, status, explanation = analyzer.check_convergence(metrics)
131
132                if converged and convergence_iteration is None:
133                    convergence_iteration = i
134                    break
135
136            # Calculate detection accuracy
137            actual_convergence = len(cost_history) - 5  # Assume convergence 5 iterations before end
138            if convergence_iteration is not None:
139                detection_error = abs(convergence_iteration - actual_convergence)
140                detection_accuracy = max(0.0, 1.0 - detection_error / max(actual_convergence, 1))
141            else:
142                detection_accuracy = 0.0  # Failed to detect convergence
143
144            return {
145                'scenario': scenario,
146                'actual_convergence_iteration': actual_convergence,
147                'detected_convergence_iteration': convergence_iteration,
148                'detection_accuracy': detection_accuracy,
149                'final_cost': result['best_cost'],
150                'convergence_status': status.value if converged else 'not_converged',
151                'analysis_successful': True
152            }
153
154        except Exception as e:
155            return {
156                'scenario': scenario,
157                'error': str(e),
158                'detection_accuracy': 0.0,
159                'analysis_successful': False
160            }

run_enhanced_convergence_validation()¶

Run comprehensive PSO convergence validation.

Source Code¶

 1def run_enhanced_convergence_validation() -> Dict[str, Any]:
 2    """Run comprehensive PSO convergence validation."""
 3    print("=" * 80)
 4    print("ENHANCED PSO CONVERGENCE VALIDATION - GitHub Issue #6")
 5    print("Advanced Convergence Criteria and Validation Algorithms")
 6    print("=" * 80)
 7
 8    validator = PSOConvergenceValidator()
 9
10    validation_results = {
11        'validation_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'),
12        'controller_validations': {},
13        'overall_metrics': {}
14    }
15
16    # Test all controller types
17    controller_types = [SMCType.CLASSICAL, SMCType.ADAPTIVE, SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING, SMCType.HYBRID]
18
19    all_accuracies = []
20    successful_validations = 0
21
22    for controller_type in controller_types:
23        print(f"\n🔍 Validating convergence detection for {controller_type.value}...")
24
25        controller_result = validator.validate_convergence_detection(
26            controller_type, test_scenarios=3
27        )
28
29        validation_results['controller_validations'][controller_type.value] = controller_result
30
31        if controller_result['validation_successful']:
32            accuracy = controller_result['accuracy_metrics']['mean_accuracy']
33            print(f"✅ {controller_type.value}: Validation PASSED (Accuracy: {accuracy:.1%})")
34            all_accuracies.append(accuracy)
35            successful_validations += 1
36        else:
37            accuracy = controller_result['accuracy_metrics'].get('mean_accuracy', 0.0)
38            print(f"❌ {controller_type.value}: Validation FAILED (Accuracy: {accuracy:.1%})")
39            all_accuracies.append(accuracy)
40
41    # Calculate overall metrics
42    if all_accuracies:
43        validation_results['overall_metrics'] = {
44            'overall_accuracy': np.mean(all_accuracies),
45            'accuracy_std': np.std(all_accuracies),
46            'success_rate': successful_validations / len(controller_types),
47            'min_accuracy': np.min(all_accuracies),
48            'max_accuracy': np.max(all_accuracies)
49        }
50
51    # Print summary
52    print("\n" + "=" * 60)
53    print("CONVERGENCE VALIDATION SUMMARY")
54    print("=" * 60)
55
56    overall_metrics = validation_results['overall_metrics']
57    overall_accuracy = overall_metrics.get('overall_accuracy', 0.0)
58    success_rate = overall_metrics.get('success_rate', 0.0)
59
60    print(f"Overall Accuracy: {overall_accuracy:.1%}")
61    print(f"Success Rate: {success_rate:.1%}")
62    print(f"Successful Validations: {successful_validations}/{len(controller_types)}")
63
64    if success_rate >= 0.75:
65        print("\n🎉 ENHANCED CONVERGENCE VALIDATION: SUCCESSFUL")
66        print("✅ Advanced convergence criteria validated across controllers")
67        print("✅ Multi-criteria convergence detection working properly")
68        print("✅ Statistical validation algorithms operational")
69        print("✅ Performance prediction systems validated")
70    else:
71        print("\n⚠️  ENHANCED CONVERGENCE VALIDATION: PARTIAL SUCCESS")
72        print(f"✅ {successful_validations} controllers validated successfully")
73        print("⚠️  Some convergence algorithms may need refinement")
74
75    return validation_results
